name: Microbiology Basics
description: Basic principles of microbiology including study of microscopic organisms (bacteria, viruses, protozoans, algae, and fungi), the isolation, cultivation and identification of microbes, host-parasite relationships as they relate to disease, microbial and molecular genetics, growth and control of microbes, and the human immune response to microbes. Limited to students in the Joint Program in Applied Microbiology or the Joint Program in Environmental Science and Technology.
